meanings.definition: The act of dropping personnel or supplies from an aircraft by parachute.
meanings.sent1: During the military exercise, the paradropping of soldiers was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent2: The paradropping of food and medical aid to the disaster-stricken area was crucial.
meanings.sent3: The penguins decided to try paradropping from the tree using their umbrellas.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a paradropping of love into his heart.
meanings.sent5: The paradropping of confetti at the wedding made the celebration even more magical.

meanings.definition: To drop personnel or supplies from an aircraft by parachute.
meanings.sent1: The pilot will paradrop the supplies to the stranded hikers below.
meanings.sent2: They decided to paradrop the rescue team into the remote jungle.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it could paradrop from the top shelf using a makeshift parachute.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to paradrop into the conversation, changing the mood instantly.
meanings.sent5: The music paradropped into the room, filling it with joy and rhythm.
